results.title: Notes from the underground
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description: The displaced eye of an unyielding, handheld camera studies the faces, hands and feet of commuters on the London Underground. The sequence begins as the train is leaving Temple Station, a center for the city’s law practises and named for the Order of the Knights Templars, the suppressed Medieval Order from which the Freemasons claim decent. A middle-aged commuter pulls a variety of bored expressions while Asher’s camera focuses on the gold signet ring he wears, a symbol of a Freemason. Successive characters show differing reactions, to the presence of the camera which has a pervasive power that admits no concessions to the rhythmic progress of daily routines.

results.title: Rachel; Just one of the kids
results.creator_credit: Tony Paice and Healthsharing Women. Publishing and Production Group
results.brief_description: 1. “Rachel” (40 min.) is the story of a young girl with a disability making her transition from a small rural community school to a large country technical school. 2. “Just one of the kids” (20 min.) shows the development of integration in the state school system.

results.title: Two sides of the river
results.creator_credit: Brian Carson and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: The port of Echuca was once Australia’s largest inland port along the Murray River. This program looks briefly at life on the river in the early days and at the tourist attraction that the river and its boats have become.

results.title: Peace in action
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: Peace is everyone’s responsibility. The peace program views peace issues being developed and taught in schools. Examples from primary and postprimary schools include art, student initiatives, plays, student councils and community interest. Professor Charlesworth raises issues for further discussion in schools

results.title: Computers in accounting
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, George Cass and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: Shows some of the ways in which computer technology is being used in accounting firms and examines the impact of this on small business. Some of the problems encountered by small business when installing a new computer system are discussed. Also looks at the training needed by young people seeking employment in the accounting profession.
